Reviews.Content: Stay somewhere else This hotels should be closed. It is undergoing major refurbishment and is dirty, dusty and somewhat like the Tower of Terror at WDW. This is a shame because I have stayed at this hotel at least three times in the past and it has been good. How the mighty have fallen. I would not trust this place again.
Reviews.Author: AuditorUk

Reviews.Content: Beware - Hotel Undergoing Major Renovations! We booked to stay at this hotel for several days last week which was ideal for our purposes, being so close to Dadeland Mall . However upon arrival we were dismayed to discover that the hotel is being completely renovated, floor by floor. Even the lobby has large floor-to-ceiling sheets of plastic hanging down, behind which the workmen could be heard. The Reception desk is a long table, which was shifted around to accomodate yet another large sheet of plastic. And this is where breakfast is served, at a few small cramped tables situated between the sheets of plastic in the lobby. On the bright side, the breakfast was decent, and plentiful - bacon, sausages, cereal, fruit, waffles, yoghurt, pastries. You had to hurry though, before all the seating was taken up.Our room was newly renovated, but the floor was dirty ,the furniture was dusty, there was no telephone book in the room nor any sort of hotel / area information, nothing at all. When I requested that the manager ensure the room was properly cleaned the next day, he became argumentative and confrontational - most unpleasant and rude. I was bothering him, it seemed.The following morning a member of the housekeeping staff was in the hallway - she asked me if I would like the room cleaned! Obviously the message did not get through . When I returned to the room that afternoon, the room had been cleaned- somewhat- if you overlooked the still- dusty furniture and the dried dirty marks on the floor where it had been washed without benefit of sweeping first. It seems that because the renovations are taking place, cleaning is a hit-and-miss affair.As we were out most of each day we did not have to endure the surroundings nor the unfriendly manager or receptionist for any length of time. However we would have definitely stayed somewhere else if we had been informed of the building work. We will never return to this hotel.
Reviews.Author: SunnyNow

Reviews.Content: Great location Very good location for shopping, close to the airport, not far from Coconut Grove and easy access to the Florida Keys and Florida Turnpike. If you're not interested in Miami Downtown is a very convenient place (almost across the street is the Dadeland Mall), with free parking. Rooms are clean but some works in the hotel (probably) let the corridors not so clean. Staff very helpful. Overall, I would stay here again.
Reviews.Author: Averbuch

Reviews.Content: Great Hotel This hotel is located in walking distance to the Dadeland Mall. it is very clean and the staff was very helpfull and friendly. The breakfast was vey good, with your serving of fruits, bread, eggs, sausages, cereal, etc. Hot beverages are available 24-7.The bed(full size) was a tad soft but we did have a comfortable sleep. I will recommend this hotel to anyone base on my experience.Opposite the hotel is a Circuit City store and a Barnes  Noble bookstore which are all located in a mini shopping area.Thank you for a wonderful time, we will be back.
Reviews.Author: Statiagirl

Reviews.Content: ok buty nothing fancy We stayed in February in the Ramada Dadeland, because we came from Germany to go on a cruise from Miami and wanted to stay some days afterwards in Miami to go shopping and stuff like that. Well, we chose the hotel over all because of the price, around 125,- USD, which is - in my opinion - not very cheap, but in comparison to other hotels in this time of the year... and the cheaper ones had such horrible reviews, that the Ramada seemed fine to me. Over all it was ok, nothing special, quite clean and spacious, the breakfast was really good (bagels, eggs, sometimes waffles, cereal, oatmeal, fruit) and there is coffee in the lobby 24/7. the staff was very helpful and friendly. To/from the airport ist was pretty convenient and the mall is right across (well, a few hundred meters) the street, which was great. it鈥檚 a bit far to go to south beach, but anyway... a would go there again... but i have to admit, in comparison to the hotel prices I paid a few years ago in the same time of the year in Miami South Beach, miami in general has tremendously increased their prices!!!All in all: ok, quiet, rooms clean, pool area ok (but not really for sunbathing), breakfast very good, location fine. i would recommend it for travelers with medium expectations.
Reviews.Author: SylvieWood

Reviews.Content: Better than Airport Hotles! My husband and I stayed here two nights after spending one awlful night in a hotel by the airport. We were very pleased with how clean our room was. There was a minifridge, which came in very handy and interent in our room. The front desk staff was very nice and helpful and breakfast was pretty good as well. There are a few shops within walking distance also. We didn't have any road/traffic noise and there wasn't much noise coming from other rooms. I would recommend staying here instead of the older/noiser hotels by the airport. This was a much better place and it was less expensive to top it off!
Reviews.Author: purplechevy

Reviews.Content: Filthy The room had a stinking odor. The bedspreads were sticky. There were old newspapers in the room. It was expensive. We ran away the following morning.
Reviews.Author: West_U_2005_2007

Reviews.Content: Helpful and friendly staff We stayed for a week while visiting relatives. It's very convenient for the Dadeland Mall and there is a small mall opposite that has a delightful Cuban bakery and cafe.For a Limited hotel the facilities are ok but the ice machines are on every other floor and you need to get the elevator so by the time you have got ice it's gone back down to the ground floor!Forget the pool it's close to the road and not suitable for children to play unless fully supervised.The breakfast choice was good and the staff made sure that there was a constant supply.Valuables can be kept in the lobby safe at no extra cost and free newspapers are a pleasant little extra.
Reviews.Author: Sanyo12

Reviews.Content: Never Again Would never stay at another Ramada again. Front desk called room at 1:00 p.m. accusing us that we had not paid for another day and that we had to check out or pay. We had pre-booked our room for two nights but for some reason it wasn't showing up on their computer. She then said that I was not even supposed to be in that room but yet she called me in that room to tell me that I was to change from the room I wasn't even in to the room I was already in. Then she proceeded to lie and say that she was the one who checked me in the day before when she wasn't because I even had problems with my check in, somehow my reservation got cancelled. Then when she realized it was all her fault she didn't even apoligize. The manager was even worse. When we requested to speak to him he had us wait for 10 minutes and was very smug and rude.
Reviews.Author: pixie_d

Reviews.Content: An alternative to an Airport hotel? We had a couple of nights at the Ramada just before our return flight to the UK, we'd had pretty miserable experiences in the airport hotels at Miami in the past and decided to go a little further afield. In my opinion, this was ideal in terms of location (just off the interstate 1) and only 20 mins from the airport. You also have the delights of the Dadeland Mall within walking distance and we found it to be less busy, and noisy than the airport hotels. To be honest it's worth going there for the free breakfast alone, not just the usual continental style - but with hot items such as bacon, sausage patties and eggs as well. With the exception of the food court in the mall and a surprisingly good chinese in the smaller mall directly opposite the entrance , there isn't anywhere to eat within walking distance. However, if you go back to the 1 and turn right (i.e. away from Miami) there a fab. Cuban restaraunt called Havanna Spice just by the Metro Station - give it a try, you won't regret it.
Reviews.Author: Kat_Ric

Reviews.Content: Excellent value, good facilities Hotel rates in Coral Gables and South Miami are inflated to begin with, so I was unsure what to expect when I had an Internet room rate of $109 without taxes. The description and photos looked good. All but one review at Tripadvisor had positive comments. I have had good experiences with Ramada properties in the past, so I decided to try it.My room was at the end of the hallway, and I overlooked the on ramp to route 826. Despite the location, the traffic noise was not a problem.The room was clean. The bathroom appeared to have been remodeled within the past four years (caulk was clean, but showed signs of small cracks like any caulking will in time).I would happily stay at this hotel again.
Reviews.Author: TravelerChriss

Reviews.Content: I checked out early! This was the first hotel I stayed at in my 2 week visit to Florida, and I'm sorry to say it was the worst by a long way. Perhaps my expectations were too high having read the reviews on this site, but even so, at $150 per night, I expected better than this. The room I was given was very poor - the wallpaper was peeling off the walls, the curtains had holes in them, the bedcovers and sheets had cigarette burned holes in them, the fittings in the bathroom were utterly filthy, with thick layers of dust on the air vent and other fixtures, and the room was situated right beside a motorway off ramp, along which roared traffic all night long. When I spoke to reception about the traffic noise, I was first told I couldn't be moved because I had used the room. This was about an hour after I had checked in, and the time had not been spent using anything; rather it had been been spent sitting in a stunned miserable silence gazing at the third world 'comforts' of my room. The receptionist then appeared to change her mind, but then stated that I had one of the best rooms in the hotel, and that the other rooms I could be given would be even worse!Needless to say I moved hotels at the earliest opportunity.How this hotel gets such high reviews is utterly beyond me - the other Florida hotels I stayed in, just arriving off the street, were better, and only one had a higher nightly room rate than this one.My 2 star rating for this hotel is bordering on the generous side!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Safe, Clean, Good Deal I stayed at this hotel for one night while at a graduate school interview in Miami. After reading reviews for several hotels around Miami International Airport, I was concerned about the level of cleanliness/safe location of many hotels in that area, particularly for a single woman traveling alone. The Ramada was great - clean, safe, near Dadeland Mall. It's about 12 miles south of the airport and very easy to get to. The parking lot is really tiny, but there seemed to be enough spaces. The continental breakfast in the morning had a lot of variety - coffee, juice, bagels, pastries, toast, fruit, yogurt, cereal, milk, pancakes, eggs, etc. Free Miami Herald at the door in the morning. I would definitely recommend this hotel as a good place to stay in Miami.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Fine for a one night stay This hotel is a little bit dated in appearance in the lobby but overall it is fine for a one night stay. The bedroom was spacious and clean and the shower was very good (powerful pressure). The breakfast buffet was of a high standard with fruit, yoghurt, bagels, cereal, etc. also with hot waffles and bacon. The pool area is not somewhere you would relax (it is right beside the main road and the car park). Not a bad hotel if you are just looking to lay your head down for the night, it is very close to the Dadeland Mall.
Reviews.Author: Enii

Reviews.Content: great service/location/breakfast We had a power outage at our home due to Hurricane Dennis and booked a room last minute. The employees went out of their way to work with us - scrambling to get a roll-away bed in our room. Breakfast the next morning was wonderful! Good choice of food/drinks. Very cute little cafe. All in all - had a very pleasant stay!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Great value and convenient location We stayed at the hotel after seeing the recommendations on this site and noticing that the hotel had won an award in recent years. We also were looking for a Miami hotel at under $100 a night - we paid $99 (excluding tax) a night for a room with 2 double beds.The hotel is well located towards South Miami, with the local metro stration about 10 minutes walk away which takes you straight to the heart of Miami in aout 20 minutes. It is also an easy drive from Miami International Airport and has free parking for guests. Opposite the hotel is the large Dadeland Mall which has a great range of shops and is walkable from the hotel as there are pedestrian crossing over the main road!We were impressed by the decor in the room and the widescreen TV and fridge that were there (though I'm not sure that every room has a fridge). The free continental breakfast was pretty standard, but had a reasonable selection of things on offer including 'make your own waffles' (quite a novelty for us Brits!). In addition, every day between 4pm and 6pm, the hotel puts on a 'power break' in the lobby with free juice/coffee and snacks, which is a nice touch.The shower in our bathroom broke, but someone came to look at it promptly and, once it was extablished that it couldn't be fixed immediately, moved us to the adjoining room. We were impressed that they were so quick to help us.The staff were friendly and we really enjoyed out stay here and will come again if we visit Miami again!
Reviews.Author: LMC_77

Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel in a nice area! Stayed at the Ramada Dadeland for four nights March 3-7 2005. I was very impressed by this property it was CLEAN and the staff was wonderful. The Miami area can have some very bad hotels so this was a godsend. I located this hotel using this site which has lead me to many nice accommodations. This Ramada did everything it could to make sure the stay was great and the price was very reasonable. It is even a better value if you consider the things they give you for free that usually are drastically overcharged for at a hotel. The basic room includes all this for free local calls, long distance calls anywhere in the U.S., free internet access in all rooms, free morning paper delivered to your door with other papers available free at the front desk, and a free breakfast not just bagels and fruit but eggs, meat, waffles and juices. They also set up a free snack area in the afternoon with bottle water, juice, cookies and fruit. As you can see this hotel is a great value and it is in a very safe neighborhood with free parking. Highly recommend.
Reviews.Author: firestalker

Reviews.Content: Quality hotel Wife  I spent a night at the Ramada on our way to the keys and was pleasantly surprised. Free ISDN in the room, clean room, all interior entrances, better than average continental breakfast were the standouts. Highly recommended.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Very pleased We stayed in this hotel after another Miami hotel overbooked us...the other hotel gave no reasons or apologies but sent us to this hotel. The hotel staff at this Ramada went so far out of the way to make us comfortable, it would have seemed that they are the ones who made the mistake! The rooms were very clean, the breakfast was more than enough, there were snacks in the lobby every afternoon (nothing chintzy, it was really nice). In Miami, where hospitality is not easy to find, this hotel is an exception; I would stay here again in a heartbeat.
Reviews.Author: SharonRN

Reviews.Author: Pickman
